title: Ticket #2863: RFE: Concurrency limit default grouping
description:
We would like the ability to set a grouping of concurrency limit defaults to assist in avoiding a high rate of negotiator reconfigs for concurrency limit adjustments. We envision consuming that as something like: 

CONCURRENCY_LIMIT_DEFAULT=150
CONCURRENCY_LIMIT_DEFAULT_LIST = direct,batch
CONCURRENCY_LIMIT_DEFAULT_LIST_direct = 40
CONCURRENCY_LIMIT_DEFAULT_LIST_batch = 120

A concurrency limit of "gl5000" would start with a value of 150. A concurrency limit of "direct.gl5000" would start with a value of 40. A concurrency limit of "batch.gl5000" would start with a value of 120.
remarks:
Note, I simplified the originally requested configuration scheme, as shown here:

TESTING:

Begin with this configuration, that defines some scoped cc-limit defaults and a traditional cc-limit "TEST": 

NEGOTIATOR_DEBUG = D_ACCOUNTANT | D_FULLDEBUG
NEGOTIATOR_INTERVAL = 20
NEGOTIATOR_CYCLE_DELAY = 5

# oversubscribe some slots to make testing easier:
NUM_CPUS = 25

# concurrency limit defaults:
CONCURRENCY_LIMIT_DEFAULT = 1
CONCURRENCY_LIMIT_DEFAULT_small = 2
CONCURRENCY_LIMIT_DEFAULT_medium = 5
CONCURRENCY_LIMIT_DEFAULT_large = 11

TEST_LIMIT = 3

Spin up a pool with this configuration, and submit this job: 

universe = vanilla
cmd = /bin/sleep
args = 600
transfer_executable = false
should_transfer_files = if_needed
when_to_transfer_output = on_exit
concurrency_limits = large.test
queue 20
concurrency_limits = medium.test
queue 20
concurrency_limits = small.test
queue 20
concurrency_limits = test
queue 20
concurrency_limits = undef.test
queue 20
concurrency_limits = undef
queue 20

2012-Apr-02 11:37:49 by smoler:
Nice start to the documentation, but a detail is not specified and not yet clear. In your examples and also in the example in the manual, there is always a period in the example. So, the question is: is this period a necessary part or separator with your prefix? As in, if you've set the configuration with 
CONCURRENCY_LIMIT_DEFAULT = 5
CONCURRENCY_LIMIT_DEFAULT_LARGE = 100
and then a couple of jobs use the limits: 
# one job that has the period character
concurrency_limits = large.swlicense
In your example, this job is part of the limit of 100. 
# another job that does NOT have the period character
concurrency_limits = largeswlicense
What limit does this second job fall under? 5 or 100?

Know that whatever the correct answer is, the documentation will be changed to NOT use the term groups. We don't want to overload that term and confuse folks. Yes, this certainly is a grouping (in its generic, dictionary definition), but I'll probably use wording that implies sets of jobs instead.
